title: Deputies announce arrest in shooting outside Orange County shopping center
content:
ORLANDO, Fla. —
A 24-year-old has been arrested in connection with last week's shooting in an Orange County shopping center parking lot.
The sheriff's office said Darrius William Miller faces counts of first-degree murder, attempted first-degree murder with a firearm and robbery with a firearm.
The shooting happened at the corner of North Hiawassee Road and Clarcona Ocoee Road around 4:45 p.m. Thursday.
Witnesses said two vehicles were parked next to each other and then individuals inside exchanged gunfire. Then, both vehicles left the scene.
Deputies eventually found four victims from the shooting, one of whom was pronounced dead at the scene. He was identified as David Lee Grimmage, 16.
The other three victims were treated, and they're expected to survive. The sheriff's office did not identify those victims.
